member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection
member.summary:
A resource that is used to connect third-party source providers with services like AWS CodePipeline.
Note: A connection created through CloudFormation, the CLI, or the SDK is in `PENDING` status by default. You can make its status `AVAILABLE` by updating the connection in the console.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection.ConnectionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connection. The ARN is used as the connection reference when the connection is shared between AWS services.
The ARN is never reused if the connection is deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection.ConnectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
The name of the connection. Connection names must be unique in an AWS user account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection.ConnectionStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionStatus.
The current status of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection.HostArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the host associated with the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection.OwnerAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OwnerAccountId.
The identifier of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. For Bitbucket, this is the account ID of the owner of the Bitbucket repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection.ProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderType.
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateConnection operation. Creates a connection that can then be given to other AWS services like CodePipeline so that it can access third-party code repositories. The connection is in pending status until the third-party connection handshake is completed from the console.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.ConnectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
The name of the connection to be created. The name must be unique in the calling AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.HostArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the host associated with the connection to be created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.ProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderType.
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The key-value pair to use when tagging the resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateConnection operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse.ConnectionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connection to be created. The ARN is used as the connection reference when the connection is shared between AWS services.
The ARN is never reused if the connection is deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies the tags applied to the resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateHost operation. Creates a resource that represents the infrastructure where a third-party provider is installed. The host is used when you create connections to an installed third-party provider type, such as GitHub Enterprise Server. You create one host for all connections to that provider.
A host created through the CLI or the SDK is in `PENDING` status by default. You can make its status `AVAILABLE` by setting up the host in the console.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the host to be created. The name must be unique in the calling AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest.ProviderEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderEndpoint.
The endpoint of the infrastructure to be represented by the host after it is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest.ProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderType.
The name of the installed provider to be associated with your connection. The host resource represents the infrastructure where your provider type is installed. The valid provider type is GitHub Enterprise Server.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest.Tags
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.
The VPC configuration to be provisioned for the host. A VPC must be configured and the infrastructure to be represented by the host must already be connected to the VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateHost operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostResponse.HostArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the host to be created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostResponse.Tags
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Tags.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteConnection operation. The connection to be deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionRequest.ConnectionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connection to be deleted.
The ARN is never reused if the connection is deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteConnection operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteHostRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteHost operation. The host to be deleted. Before you delete a host, all connections associated to the host must be deleted.
A host cannot be deleted if it is in the VPC_CONFIG_INITIALIZING or VPC_CONFIG_DELETING state.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteHostRequest.HostArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the host to be deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteHostResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteHost operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionRequest

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionRequest.ConnectionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a connection.

member.summary: This is the response object from the GetConnection operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse.Connection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Connection.
The connection details, such as status, owner, and provider type.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetHost operation. Returns the host ARN and details such as status, provider type, endpoint, and, if applicable, the VPC configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostRequest.HostArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the requested host.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetHost operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the requested host.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostResponse.ProviderEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderEndpoint.
The endpoint of the infrastructure represented by the requested host.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostResponse.ProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderType.
The provider type of the requested host, such as GitHub Enterprise Server.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the requested host.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetHostResponse.VpcConfiguration

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host
member.summary:
A resource that represents the infrastructure where a third-party provider is installed. The host is used when you create connections to an installed third-party provider type, such as GitHub Enterprise Server. You create one host for all connections to that provider.
A host created through the CLI or the SDK is in `PENDING` status by default. You can make its status `AVAILABLE` by setting up the host in the console.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.HostArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the host.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the host.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.ProviderEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderEndpoint.
The endpoint of the infrastructure where your provider type is installed.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.ProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderType.
The name of the installed provider to be associated with your connection. The host resource represents the infrastructure where your provider type is installed. The valid provider type is GitHub Enterprise Server.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the host, such as PENDING, AVAILABLE, VPC_CONFIG_DELETING, VPC_CONFIG_INITIALIZING, and VPC_CONFIG_FAILED_INITIALIZATION.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
The status description for the host.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Host.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.
The VPC configuration provisioned for the host.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.AmazonCodeStarconnectionsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CodeStarconnections
AWS CodeStar Connections
This AWS CodeStar Connections API Reference provides descriptions and usage examples of the operations and data types for the AWS CodeStar Connections API. You can use the connections API to work with connections and installations.
Connections are configurations that you use to connect AWS resources to external code repositories. Each connection is a resource that can be given to services such as CodePipeline to connect to a third-party repository such as Bitbucket. For example, you can add the connection in CodePipeline so that it triggers your pipeline when a code change is made to your third-party code repository. Each connection is named and associated with a unique ARN that is used to reference the connection.
When you create a connection, the console initiates a third-party connection handshake. Installations are the apps that are used to conduct this handshake. For example, the installation for the Bitbucket provider type is the Bitbucket app. When you create a connection, you can choose an existing installation or create one.
When you want to create a connection to an installed provider type such as GitHub Enterprise Server, you create a host for your connections.
You can work with connections by calling:
CreateConnection, which creates a uniquely named connection that can be referenced by services such as CodePipeline.
DeleteConnection, which deletes the specified connection.
GetConnection, which returns information about the connection, including the connection status.
ListConnections, which lists the connections associated with your account.
You can work with hosts by calling:
CreateHost, which creates a host that represents the infrastructure where your provider is installed.
DeleteHost, which deletes the specified host.
GetHost, which returns information about the host, including the setup status.
ListHosts, which lists the hosts associated with your account.
You can work with tags in AWS CodeStar Connections by calling the following:
ListTagsForResource, which gets information about AWS tags for a specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in AWS CodeStar Connections.
TagResource, which adds or updates tags for a resource in AWS CodeStar Connections.
UntagResource, which removes tags for a resource in AWS CodeStar Connections.
For information about how to use AWS CodeStar Connections, see the Developer Tools User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.AmazonCodeStarconnectionsClient.CreateHost(Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that represents the infrastructure where a third-party provider is installed. The host is used when you create connections to an installed third-party provider type, such as GitHub Enterprise Server. You create one host for all connections to that provider.
A host created through the CLI or the SDK is in `PENDING` status by default. You can make its status `AVAILABLE` by setting up the host in the console.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeStarconnections.IAmazonCodeStarconnections.CreateHost(Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateHostRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that represents the infrastructure where a third-party provider is installed. The host is used when you create connections to an installed third-party provider type, such as GitHub Enterprise Server. You create one host for all connections to that provider.
A host created through the CLI or the SDK is in `PENDING` status by default. You can make its status `AVAILABLE` by setting up the host in the console.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateHost service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateHost service method, as returned by CodeStarconnections.
member.exception: Exceeded the maximum limit for connections.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateHost Operation
